item.title: ggplot with plotly
item.description: library(ggplot2) library(plotly) ## ## Attaching package: 'plotly' ## The following object is masked from 'package:ggplot2': ## ## last_plot ## The following object is masked from 'package:stats': ## ## filter ## The following object is masked from 'package:graphics': ## ## layout p <- ggplot(data = diamonds, aes(x = cut, fill = clarity)) + geom_bar(position = "dodge") ggplotly(p) {"x":{"data":[{"orientation":"v","width":[0.1125,0.1125,0.1125,0.1125,0.112500000000001],"base":[0,0,0,0,0],"x":[0.60625,1.60625,2.60625,3.60625,4.60625],"y":[210,96,84,205,146],"text":["count: 210 cut: Fair clarity: I1","count: 96

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com.
